slides.title: Ikaruga Cat
slides.text: An "Ikaruga" game is a Japanese name for color-matching games. In this game, you move the cat with the mouse and try to collect apples of the same color as the cat. You can press the space key to change the cat's color. The game is over if you touch an apple of a different color.

slides.title: Rename the Cat Sprite
slides.text: Rename the sprite from "Sprite1" to "Cat".

slides.title: Add Costumes to the Cat Sprite
slides.text: On the Costumes tab, duplicate the costume twice.

slides.title: Repaint the Cat Costumes
slides.text: Paint the costumes red, blue, and green (in that order).

slides.title: Set the Backdrop
slides.text: Change the backdrop to "Light".

slides.title: Create the "Score" Variable
slides.text: Click "Make a Variable" to make the Score variable.

slides.title: Add Cat Code
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Cat sprite:
when green flag clicked
set Score to 0
set size to 50%

slides.title: Add Cat Code
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Cat sprite:
forever
if mouse down? then

slides.title: Add Cat Code
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Cat sprite:
point towards mouse-pointer
move 10 steps

slides.title: Test #1
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • The cat points towards the mouse cursor.
  • The cat moves towards the mouse cursor when you hold the mouse button down.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add Cat Code
slides.text:
9Add the following code to the Cat sprite:
when space key pressed
next costume

slides.title: Test #2
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Then test to make sure your program has the following:
  • When the space key is pressed, the cat changes color.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add the Apple Sprite
slides.text: Add the new Apple sprite from the Sprite Library.

slides.title: Add Costumes to the Apple Sprite
slides.text: Duplicate the apple's costume twice.

slides.title: Repaint the Apple Costumes
slides.text: Paint the apple costumes red, blue, and green (in that order).

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
when green flag clicked
hide
set size to 50%
forever

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
wait pick random 0.1 to 1 secs
point in direction pick random -180 to 180

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
switch costume to pick random 1 to 3
create clone of myself

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
when I start as a clone
show
forever

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
move 3 steps
if on edge, bounce

slides.title: Test #3
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Apples of random colors begin spawning.
  • The apples move and bounce off the walls.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
if (touching Cat?) then

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
if ((costume #) = (costume # of Cat)) then else

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
change Score by 1
delete this clone

slides.title: Test #4
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Test to make sure your program has the following:
  • Apples the same color as the cat disappear when the cat touches them.
  • Apples of different colors do not disappear when the cat touches them.
  • The Score increases by one for each same-color apple the cat touches.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.

slides.title: Add Code to Apple
slides.text:
21Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
broadast Game Over and wait

slides.title: Add Code to the Cat
slides.text:
Add the following code to the Apple sprite:
when I receive Game Over
stop other scripts in sprite
say (Oh no! Game over!) for (2) secs
stop all

slides.title: Test #5
slides.text:
Click on File > Save. Test to make sure your program has the following:
  • When the cat touches a different-colored apple, it says "Oh no! Game over!" and the game ends.
If the program doesn't do all of these things, check the previous steps to make sure you copied the code exactly. If you still can't figure it out, ask for help.
